TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit CompilerMarshalOverride extends System.Object
public ref class CompilerMarshalOverride abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Indicates that the modified instance of a variable differs from its true type when marshaling. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CompilerMarshalOverride> class allows the common language runtime to marshal using the correct sizes.
Some behaviors of the common language runtime are incompatible with some languages. For example, C++ treats Boolean variables as single-byte values, while the common language runtime marshals them as four-byte values to match the `BOOLEAN` type defined by the Microsoft Windows API. To work around such issues, the C++ compiler emits this modifier on any `wchar_t` or `bool` parameter or function return.
